Package miPhysics

Class PhysicalModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • miPhysics.PhysicalModel
  • public class PhysicalModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class in which to create a 3D mass-interaction physical model. A global physical context is created, then populated with modules, which can then be computed. Within this physical context, modules can be accessed in two ways: by using their identification String (a unique name for each module) or by using their index in the Mat and Link module tables. See example: HelloMass

      • draw_physics

        public void draw_physics()
        Run the physics simulation (call once every draw method). Automatically computes the correct number of steps depending on the simulation rate / display rate ratio. Should be called once the model creation is finished and the init() method has been called.

      • computeNSteps

        Parameters:
        N - number of steps to compute.

      • addMass3D

        public int addMass3D​(java.lang.String name,
                     double mass,
                     Vect3D initPos,
                     Vect3D initVel)
        Add a 3D Mass module to the model (this Mass is subject to gravity).
        Parameters:
        name - the identifier of the Mass
        mass - the mass' inertia value.
        initPos - the mass' initial position
        initVel - the mass' initial velocity (in distance unit per second)
        Returns:
        0 if everything goes well.

        public int addOsc3D​(java.lang.String name,
                    double mass,
                    double K,
                    double Z,
                    Vect3D initPos,
                    Vect3D initVel)
        Add a 3D oscillator (mass-spring-ground) to the model model.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Oscillator module.
        mass - the Oscillator's mass value
        K - the Oscillator's stiffness value
        Z - the Oscillator's damping value
        initPos - initial position of the Oscillator module.
        initVel - initial velocity of the Oscillator module (in distance unit per second).
        Returns:
        0 if everything goes well.

                       double paramK,
                       java.lang.String m1_Name,
                       java.lang.String m2_Name)
        Add a 3D Spring to the model.
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the Spring.
        dist - resting distance.
        paramK - stiffness.
        m1_Name - name of Mat module connected to 1st end
        m2_Name - name of Mat module connected to 2nd end
        Returns:
        O if all goes well.

      • addSpringDamper3D

        public int addSpringDamper3D​(java.lang.String name,
                             double dist,
                             double paramK,
                             double paramZ,
                             java.lang.String m1_Name,
                             java.lang.String m2_Name)

        name - identifier of the Spring-Damper.
        dist - resting distance.
        paramK - stiffness value.
        paramZ - damping value.

      • addSpringDamper1D

        public int addSpringDamper1D​(java.lang.String name,
                             double dist,
                             double paramK,
                             double paramZ,
                             java.lang.String m1_Name,
                             java.lang.String m2_Name)

      • addRope3D

        public int addRope3D​(java.lang.String name,
                     double dist,
                     double paramK,
                     double paramZ,
                     java.lang.String m1_Name,
                     java.lang.String m2_Name)
        Add a 3D "rope-like" Spring and Damper module to the model. This interaction will only be active in case of a positive elongation. If the rope is not tight (elongation smaller than resting distance) the interaction does nothing.
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the Rope.
        dist - resting distance.
        paramK - stiffness value.
        paramZ - damping value.
        m1_Name - name of Mat module connected to 1st end
        m2_Name - name of Mat module connected to 2nd end
        Returns:
        O if all goes well.

      • addContact3D

        public int addContact3D​(java.lang.String name,
                        double dist,
                        double paramK,
                        double paramZ,
                        java.lang.String m1_Name,
                        java.lang.String m2_Name)
        Add a 3D Contact module to the model.
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the Contact module.
        dist - (threshold) below which the Contact becomes active.
        paramK - stiffness value.
        paramZ - damping value.
        m1_Name - name of Mat module connected to 1st end
        m2_Name - name of Mat module connected to 2nd end
        Returns:
        O if all goes well.

      • addBubble3D

        public int addBubble3D​(java.lang.String name,
                       double dist,
                       double paramK,
                       double paramZ,
                       java.lang.String m1_Name,
                       java.lang.String m2_Name)
        Add a 3D Bubble (enclosing circle module to the model.
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the Bubble module.
        dist - radius of the circle (distance above which the interaction will become active).
        paramK - stiffness value.
        paramZ - damping value.
        m1_Name - name of Mat module connected to 1st end
        m2_Name - name of Mat module connected to 2nd end
        Returns:
        O if all goes well.

      • addDamper3D

        public int addDamper3D​(java.lang.String name,
                       double paramZ,
                       java.lang.String m1_Name,
                       java.lang.String m2_Name)
        Add a 3D Friction-based Damper module to the model.
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the Damper.
        paramZ - damping value.
        m1_Name - name of Mat module connected to 1st end
        m2_Name - name of Mat module connected to 2nd end
        Returns:
        O if all goes well.

      • addPlaneContact

        public int addPlaneContact​(java.lang.String name,
                           double l0,
                           double paramK,
                           double paramZ,
                           int or,
                           double pos,
                           java.lang.String m1_Name)
        Add an interaction with a 2D plane.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the Plane Interaction module.
        l0 - distance below which the interaction becomes active.
        paramK - stiffness value.
        paramZ - damping value.
        or - orientation of the plane (0: x-plane, 1: y-plane, 2: z-plane)
        pos - position of the plane along the axis defined by or.
        m1_Name - name of the Mat module connected to this Plane.
        Returns:

        0 if success, throws error otherwise.

        public void getAllMatSpeedsOfType​(java.util.ArrayList<PVector> pArray,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<PVector> vArray,
                                  matModuleType m)
        Create and fill two Array Lists with the positions and velocities (per sample) of all modules of a given type. DEPRECEATED FUNCTION, use createPosSpeedArraysForModType and update instead.
        Parameters:
        pArray - the position ArrayList (that will be cleared and refilled).
        vArray - the velocity ArrayList (that will be cleared and refilled).
        m - the module type that we are looking for.

      • createPosSpeedArraysForModType

        public void createPosSpeedArraysForModType​(java.util.ArrayList<PVector> pArray,
                                           java.util.ArrayList<PVector> vArray,
                                           matModuleType m)
        Create and fill two Array Lists with the positions and velocities (per sample) of all modules of a given type. Use this for creating the new arrays before the simulation is launched. Once the simulation is running, use the updatePosSpeedArraysForModType method to update the existing ArrayLists. Quite inefficient method (checks all Mat modules for a given type)
        Parameters:
        pArray - the position ArrayList (that will be cleared and refilled).
        vArray - the velocity ArrayList (that will be cleared and refilled).
        m - the module type that we are looking for.

      • updatePosSpeedArraysForModType

        public void updatePosSpeedArraysForModType​(java.util.ArrayList<PVector> pArray,
                                           java.util.ArrayList<PVector> vArray,
                                           matModuleType m)
        Update two Array Lists with the positions and velocities (per sample) of all modules of a given type. Use this after createPosSpeedArraysForModType, once the simulation is running to update existing arrays. Quite inefficient method (checks all Mat modules for a given type)
        Parameters:
        pArray - the position ArrayList.
        vArray - the velocity ArrayList.
        m - m the module type that we are looking for.
